intro: Lobelia orbiculata f. subcuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, preferring moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a distinctive subcuneate base, giving it its botanical designation. This variety is often found in sandy or peaty soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
